definition: variant of 伏羲[Fu2 Xi1]
to lean over/to fall (go down)/to hide (in ambush)/to conceal oneself/to lie low/hottest days of summer/to submit/to concede defeat/to overcome/to subdue/volt
surname Fu
sacrifice
another name for 伏羲[Fu2 Xi1], consort of 女媧|女娲[Nu:3 wa1]
one of the five legendary emperors, also called 嚳|喾[Ku4]
Bamboo Annals, early chronicle of Chinese ancient history, written c. 300 BC
Nüwa (creator of humans in Chinese mythology)
Fuxi or Fu Hsi, legendary Chinese emperor 2852-2738 BC, mythical creator of fishing, trapping, and writing

the Yellow Emperor, mythological emperor of China, reigned c. 2697-2597 BC
oracle inscriptions of the Shang Dynasty (16th-11th century BC) on tortoiseshells or animal bones

tribes under the Yellow Emperor
Imperial Readings of the Taiping Era, general Song dynasty encyclopedia compiled during 977-983 under Li Fang 李昉[Li3 Fang3], 1000 scrolls
Fuxi or Fu Hsi, legendary Chinese emperor, trad. 2852-2738 BC, mythical creator of fishing, trapping and writing
alternative name for the Yellow Emperor 黃帝|黄帝
